runs.comm: good start from the quick man, bounding in from a six mile run up, landing on a decent length and line, worked to midwicket for a single
good start from Clarke as opener, lifting what was actually a good rising delivery over the wicketkepper's head, one-bounce for four
Clarke enjoying the pace and carry, clipping a cut shot away for a couple
tough work already for Shoaib, he's not actually bowled that badly, but a fraction outside off and Clarke cuts firmly past point for four
good response here from the bowler, better length and good line, Clarke blocks firmly to cover

oh it's all kicking off, plenty of stares and plenty of words from bowler and batsman, really top delivery, climbed from a length straight threw Clarke's attempted flay and Akmal took the ball well above his head
Aamer is an altogether more lean and lithe prospect than Shoaib and starts well, full and following Warner outside leg, thuds off a flurry of bat and pad away to square leg for a single
lovely shot from Michael Clarke, not butchering the ball as his opening partner may, just easing a cover drive over the infield for four
Clarke happy to hand leg side of the ball as Aamer pushed it across him, aims another cover drive, but this time finds the fielder
slightly back of a length from Aamer, pushed towards point for a quick single

gone! Aamer strikes early again! It was fired in full and straight, Warner tried to mow it over midwicket and it crashed into his back leg, looks unlucky for the batsman, it was heading past the leg stump with the angle
good first ball to the new batsman, forces him back and into a defensive shot in a flash
this is seriously swift stuff from Shoaib, can still get it through in a hurry despite his age, he's probably lucky to get away with this, it was crashed to point
Clarke is really ticking, Shaib has got his adrenaline flowing, it was a touch short from the bowler and he clumped a pull shot wide of midwicket for four
lucky for the batsman this time, full and Clarke sliced it in the air down towards deep point, but the fielder could not get in in time to take the catch

Shoaib strikes! Crowd has gone wild, Afridi running around like a mad man! Tim Paine tried to flap a quick, rising ball into the leg side but couldn't get much on it and it looped towards mid off where Gul took a decent catch over his head
slower ball, good thinking from Shoaib, Clarke read it though and threaded a well-timed drive to deep point
he may look like he's bowled 30 overs, and with a run up like his you can understand him looking a little weary, but Shoaib has got this straight through Hopes before he had a chance to play a shot
Aamer glides into another quick delivery, lovely action he has, Clarke is equally graceful, timing a crisp drive down to mid off
good from Aamer, Clarke edged leg side and the bowler followed up, cramping any room so it could only be pushed towards the covers for one
Hopes gets a firm connection here, working it into the leg side for one
lovely shot and the ground is stunned into silence. Fair to say it's a one-eyed crowd! Clarke edged down the wicket and crisply eased it past the bowler for four
oh top shot! It was there for it, full and with a touch of width, but Clarke absolutely drilled it through cover for four

gone this time! Clarke's chopped on! A bit short, Clarke was looking to cut it away, but it cramped him for room and he under-edged it on to his stumps. Aamer is so excited that he leaps into the departing batsman, and there is a lovely moment where they pat each other on the back
Shoaib is working up really good pace, full and straight and defended
well Hopes is looking a little startled here, flashing at thin air outside off stump
lovely shot, really good from Hopes, picked a slower ball and drove firmly towards cover where Afridi dives and pulls off an excellent save
Shoaib just gets this one wrong, sliding it down the leg side
lovely ball this, on a good length, outside off stump, just offering to go away off the wicket, and Hussey aims a flat-footed waft
Shoaib is through him again and having a real word with Hussey, who backed away and swished at nothing outside off
slower ball to finish, nicely delivered, Hussey watches it carefully and pushed towards cover for a single
pretty gentle start, clipped to short fine leg for a quick single
top shot this, really confident stuff from Hopes, went down very early for a reverse sweep, Ajmal fired it in quicker, but Hopes connected well and threaded it through point for four
unlucky for the bowler here, Hopes went for a conventional sweep, and top-edged it over short fine leg for another boundary
fired in much quicker and clipped away for a single towards midwicket
another single, just worked into the leg side
doosra here, and not read by the batsman, gets a leading edge towards mid off
wow, Hussey has timed this perfectly, looked nothing more than a routine work to leg from a shortish ball but it sped between fine leg and square leg for four
follows up the boundary with a soft-handed push into the off side for a quick single
shoved it a touch shorter, Hopes slapped a front-foot pull, without much timing one-bounce to long on
good stuff this from Hussey, quietly pushed down the ground for a single
very good from Hopes, with the silence from the crowd you never know if these shots are timed, but it certainly was, Hopes pulling a shortish ball through midwicket for four
that's better from Gul, full and straight and dug out in front of midwicket for a single
starts well, speared into middle and blocked to cover
touch of spin here, but more Kumble than Warne, cut firmly to deep point for a single
this time it's fired in towards the legs and thuds off bat and pad towards short fine leg for one
nicely done from Hopes, he's doing a good job now, clipping firmly in front of midwicket for a couple
and again, a touch short and Hopes pulled it carefully in front of midwicket for a couple more
quicker ball to finish and Hopes drives to cover
dot balls are almost as useful, and here it's driven firmly back to the bowler
dot ball again, Gul finding his range this over, tight line outside off, driven crisply but straight to Afridi at mid off, who has another chat with his bowler
this time there is a single, full and straight and clipped to long on for one
very good from Gul, there is nothing on offer here for the Australian batsmen, speared in full and straight and it's dug out to long on again

touch of swing, first time we've seen that from Pakistan today, but it ends up going for three, as it's worked to deep midwicket where Umar fires in a throw that Gul fails to collect allowing a bonus third
once again it's full and straight, with a touch of indrift, and it's clipped for a single
the batsmen are doing this well now, Pakistan under pressure, clipped to deep point for a swiftly taken couple
this time it's fired towards leg stump and worked towards deep square leg for a single
two more, excellent running, it was carefully worked into the square leg region
Hussey this time clips it away off the front foot for a single to square leg
better from Afridi, nothing for Hopes to work with and blocked back to the bowler
clipped away for a leg side single to finish a good over for Australia
a hint of turn in to the batsman, who backs away and slaps to backward point
easy single for Hussey, who just pushes the ball into the covers and sets off. The fielders are right back on the edge of the circle, plenty of opportunity for sneaky singles
Hopes goes down on bended knee to slog sweep but the ball thumps into the pad. Big appeal from Ajmal, but the ball was going over as well as missing leg
another attempted slog sweep as Ajmal keeps darting them in to leg stump, again he can't connect
full toss clipped behind square on the leg side
drilled down to long-on
chipped to long-on

great piece of work by Kamran Akmal behind the stumps! Afridi drifted a quicker one in to beat the inside edge of the bat as Hopes lunges forward and over-balances, dragging his back leg out. World-class stumping, great effort, and Afridi is ecstatic!
nudged to wide long-on, Afridi is determined to stop them getting two and hares after the ball himself!
short, much too short and Afridi is kicking the turf in disgust! Hussey is not going to miss out on those, and pulls very hard infront of square to pick up a boundary
worked with plenty of bottom hand down to long-on
short and wide outside off this time, and its carved out to the cover sweeper

smell that! Well, Shoaib runs his fingers over this one as he slams it into the turf halfway down, but the ball spits up viciously off a length to scoot past the batsman's grille. Shoaib wanders down to have a polite word in his ear...
forced out square on the off side off the back foot
very full as Hussey backs away to leg, but he gets a good connection to drill the ball to long-off, where Umar Gul charges across and makes a good, sliding stop
slower ball from Shoaib, outside off and Hussey can't get it away ... but he's over-stepped! That's a no-ball, so we have a Free hit coming up
Hussey capitalises on the free hit, stepping away to leg and scything a full ball through cover. Spanked! All along the ground, beating the cover sweeper
another quick yorker from Shoaib, but Hussey manages to jam it out to long-off

Shoaib charges in and raps the batsman's pads with an inswinging length delivery! Wow, he really looks pooped, barely has the energy to appeal for the lbw. It was slipping down leg though, so not even considered.
White goes big, and he goes straight! He didn't send it for maximum, but collects a one-bounce four straight down the ground. Very strong shot
fuller this time, slammed back to the bowler

gone this time! White tries to clear the boundary again, on the leg side this time. He hit right across the line and got a huge leading edge, the ball went really high but not too far, and Shoaib Malik circles underneath to hold onto a regulation catch! Advantage: Pakistan.
driven out to long-off
fast offcutter from Afridi, but he's slipped onto Hussey's pads and the batsman has no trouble gliding the ball away very fine on the leg side to get off the mark with a boundary!
full, and worked to long-on
just too short, cut away infront of point
quick armball, wristily worked across the line and out to deep midwicket off the back foot
quick again, but also just too short and Hussey hops back and across to nudge to short fine leg

Ajmal strikes! It was slightly slower through the air, and he pushed his up closer to the batsman as well. Hussey shapes to flick to leg but gets a leading edge to chip the ball ever so softly back to the bowler! Pakistan are flying now, Ajmal has won his battle with Hussey, D. Now for Hussey, M.

O'Keefe has no idea about this one. I'm not sure he's ever faced a spinner of Ajmal's class before, and he doesn't pick the doosra at all, backing away to leg and thrusting his bat out. Lucky not to edge that
very tentative again from O'Keefe, tapping defensively back down the track
driven on the up down to long-off
bouncer from Aamer, and it flies over the middle and leg stumps as O'Keefe ducks underneath it. Borderline wide, but the umpire calls one for the over
slower-ball bouncer from Aamer this time, O'Keefe seemed to pick it and tried to send the ball into orbit, but couldn't get a touch on it!
quick yorker this time, jammed out to the point fielder and Hussey calls him through for a scampered single

classic Mike Hussey! What a shot at this stage of the innings, Aamer sent down a half-volley outside off and Hussey just nailed it through cover with a textbook drive. No need for anything innovative, he just slapped it right out of the middle, all along the ground. Fielders didn't even move
pushed to long-off, and he keeps the strike
speared down on middle and leg, Hussey nurdles to leg and some very sharp running gets him two
ooh, that was the 'other one' from Ajmal, Hussey didn't quite pick it but chopped the ball into the covers for a quick single

four runs for O'Keefe! His first in international cricket, and it's a decent one. Not a great ball from Ajmal, long-hop outside off and O'Keefe steps back to force through cover. Well-timed, and they boundary sweeper can't cut it off

appeal for a stumping! Ajmal went fuller, and beat the edge as O'Keefe looked to run the ball down to third man. He dragged his foot forward as Kamran collected and whipped the bails off, but kept his foot grounded inside the crease. Not out.

this is an interesting one... the ball squirts behind square on the leg side off an inside edge and Hussey charges through for the single, O'Keefe is late to respond to the call as the throw is fired to the non-striker's end. Ajmal collects and breaks the stumps, but lets go of the ball as he does ... tough one for the third umpire... That's out! He only let go of the ball after the stumps were disturbed. Huge cheer from the crowd as the decision came up on the big screen!
cracked wide of long-off, just the single though as Hussey will want to keep the strike
shot! Edgbaston falls silent as Hussey paddles a length ball very fine, wide of the short fine leg fielder for four!

four more! Hussey is playing so intelligently here, he would've seen that field change and clips a leg-stump half-volley out behind square on the leg side, right between the fielders! Gul under pressure now
what a response! Gul comes round the wicket to Hussey and fires in a yorker right at the toes, aimed straight at leg stump. The best Hussey can do is dig it out back to the bowler

Hussey goes! Gul strikes! Edgbaston erupts! Hussey gets low down and attempts the reverse-sweep, but is struck on the front pad on the line of off stump. Gul has rent the skies of Birmingham with the appeal, and the umpire agrees. Good decision, that would've taken out middle and leg
great fielding from Saeed Ajmal! Nannes inside edges to fine leg, that looked like four all the way but Ajmal charged round and threw his body down to stop it, keeping the ball inside the rope
bouncer! Nannes ducks underneath it, but he didn't even have to, that ballooned over him and is rightfully called wide
driven down to long-off, they decide against the single though to keep Johnson on strike

pinpoint yorker from Aamer, strikes Johnson on the back foot! Huge appeal, Asad Rauf thinks about it for a long time and eventually raises the finger! Brave decision, that looked to be sliding very leg-stumpy
how has that missed? Tait is beaten for pace by a full ball that shaves past the outside edge of the bat and the off stump
full and fast again, Tait just pushes it back to the bowler
Tait backs way to leg this time and lifts the ball to long-on. Flat-batted it, but didn't time it at all
what a shot from Nannes! Full on the off stump and Nannes cracks it very hard in the air, and straight! Long-off charges round but can't cut it off. Nannes still believes...
Nannes heaves mightily to leg now, but connects only with fresh air as the ball shoots over the top of leg stump
Tait backs away to leg as Gul fires in an inswinging yorker, slapping the ball to extra cover. Just a single though
yorker again from Gul, wide of off and it shoots underneath Nannes' bat as he tries to swish through the off side
six! Gul misses his mark with the yorker, turning it into a half-volley. Nannes closed his eyes and swung, connecting well to send the ball sailing over long-off!

it's all over! Nannes jams out another yorker, confusion in the running as both he and Tait are unsure whether to try and steal a single. Gul charges through after his follow-through, picks up the ball and whips the bail off to end the game.The Pakistan team converge, all smiles and the partisan crowd cheer their victory
